name: elegantly
content:

B2 in a way that is graceful and attractive in appearance or behaviour: elegantly dressed The cottage was simply and elegantly furnished.
in a way that is clever but simple, and therefore attractive: Stan's idea is elegantly simple. It is an elegantly written and deeply researched study. See
elegant
More examplesFewer examplesHe wore an elegantly tailored suit. The perfume is elegantly contained in a slender glass bottle. A table was elegantly decorated with a cloth of lavender and purple flowers. She walks and dances very elegantly.The show is skilfully acted and directed and elegantly produced.Their elegantly simple solution has helped reclaim 3 feet of San Francisco's coastline.
